result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Tritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Amended 04-08-2016:  Probation term is amended to 12 months (maximum term allowable per statute).
Concurrent with: Case 15CM182.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs and DNA surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if Agent deems appropriate.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through with any treatment recommended if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

Any firearms that were seized can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding police agency.  If the firearms were sold, the appropriate documentation/verification will need to be filed with the holding police agency by 03-31-2016 for release to the new owner(s).

records.addlTxt: dated 3/31/16 filed by DOC requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for Count 2
Packet of Charcater Letters, received and filed in court.
Received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ronald J Tritz in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.
Victim notification has been complied with.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:  
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation: 18 Months.
Concurrent to:  Case 15CM182
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant is not possess any firearms.
DV Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  victim listed in the complaint
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

Any firearm that were seized can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding police agency.
However, if the firearms were sold, the appropriate documentation/verification will need to be filed with the holding police agency by 03/31/16 for release to the new owner(s).
